trans-unit.source: Provides design-time support in a visual designer for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView"></xref> control.

In a visual designer, when you switch from Source to Design view, the markup source code that describes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control is parsed and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface.
When you switch back to Source view, the design-time control is persisted to the markup source code and edited into the markup for the Web page.

The properties of the GridViewDesigner class provide the following functionality: - The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.ActionLists%2A> property returns a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> object, which typically contains an object that is derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> class for each level in the inheritance tree of the designer.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.AutoFormats%2A> property returns a collection of formatting schemes for display in the **Auto Format** dialog box.

- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property returns a collection of template groups for the fields of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control and the top-level <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> templates.

- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property always returns `true`, indicating that the designer creates a temporary copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> to generate the design-time markup.

The methods of the GridViewDesigner class provide the following functionality: - The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.DataBind%2A> method binds the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control to a design-time data source.

- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method returns the markup that is used to render the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> at design time.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.Initialize%2A> method prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView>.

- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.OnClick%2A> method is called when a region of the design-time view of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> is clicked.

- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.OnSchemaRefreshed%2A> method is called when the schema of the data source of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> changes.

- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method is used to remove or add properties or to shadow properties of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView>.

Design-time editable regions are not supported in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control, so the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.GetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.SetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> methods have no functionality.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner"></xref> class.

The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner> class when it creates the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control or a copy of that control on the design surface.
Gets or sets the designer action list collection for this designer.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection"></xref> associated with this designer.
Gets or sets the collection of predefined formatting schemes to display in the **Auto Format** dialog box.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormatCollection> object is populated from an XML-encoded member of an internal class.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormatCollection"></xref> that contains the predefined schemes for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView"></xref>.
Binds the associated control to the design-time data source.

The DataBind method binds the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control to the design-time data source and assigns a unique value to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion.DesignerRegionAttributeName> field of each cell of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control's design-time rendering.
The `dataBoundControl` parameter is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control that is associated with this designer, or a copy of that control.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView"></xref> to bind to the design-time data source.
Gets the markup that is used to render the associated control at design time.
The GetDesignTimeHtml method does the following: 1.
Sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.AutoGenerateColumns%2A> property of the control to `true`, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Columns%2A> property is empty.
Sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.DataKeyNames%2A> property of the control to `null`, if the schema of the data source cannot be obtained.
Refreshes the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> object to force the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method to be called.
Calls the base method to generate the markup.
A <xref:System.String> containing the markup used to render the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView"></xref> at design time.
Gets the markup that is used to render the associated control at design time and populates a collection of designer regions.

The GetDesignTimeHtml method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.GridViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml> method to generate the markup for the design-time rendering of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
The GetDesignTimeHtml also populates `regions` with a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion> object for each clickable or selectable region of the design-time rendering.
For the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView>, the first cell in each row is selectable; all the cells in the rows are clickable.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection"></xref> to which definitions of the selectable and clickable regions in the design-time view of the control are added.
A <xref:System.String> containing the markup used to render the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView"></xref> at design time.
Returns the content for an editable region of the design-time view of the associated control.
This functionality is currently not available.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion"></xref> for which to fetch content.
<xref:System.String>.
Prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated control.
The designer host calls the Initialize method when it is ready to use the designer to render the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
The Initialize and its base methods configure properties and set up events that are necessary for the operation of the designer.
The `component` parameter is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control that is associated with this designer, or a copy of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView"></xref>, which implements an <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref>.
Called when a region of the design-time view of the associated control is clicked.
The OnClick method saves the selected region index and updates the markup that renders the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control on the design surface.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionMouseEventArgs"></xref> that defines the clicked region of the control.
Called when the schema of the data source for the associated control changes.

Unless the designer is in template-editing mode or a field is being added or edited, the OnSchemaRefreshed method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.InvokeTransactedChange%2A> method, which in turn calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.OnComponentChanged%2A> method to update the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control to reflect the data source change.
Used by the designer to remove properties from or add additional properties to the display in the **Properties** grid or to shadow properties of the associated control.

Control designers use methods that are derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to shadow various control properties with corresponding design-time properties that the designer implements, and to add properties to or remove properties from the **Properties** grid.

For the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control, the PreFilterProperties method sets the <xref:System.ComponentModel.BrowsableAttribute> object of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Columns%2A> property to `false` when the control is in template mode.
This is so a column that is in template mode cannot be deleted using the **Fields** dialog box.
A collection implementing the <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> of the added and shadowed properties.
Gets or sets the number of sample rows for the associated control to display.

If the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control allows paging and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.PageSize%2A> property is greater than 0, the SampleRowCount property returns the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.PageSize%2A> plus 1 (but not greater than 100).
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> does not allow paging or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.PageSize%2A> is 0, SampleRowCount returns `5`.
The number of sample rows.
Specifies content for an editable region of the design-time view for the associated control.
The SetEditableDesignerRegionContent method has no functionality; there is no support for editable regions in the design-time view of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion"></xref> to update.
A <xref:System.String> to write to `region`.
Gets or sets a collection of template groups for the fields of the associated control.

The TemplateGroups property constructs a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup> objects, one for each templated data field and one for each control template (pager and empty data) in the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
The data field <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup> elements have a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateDefinition> object for each of the predefined row template types.
The control template <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup> elements contain a single <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateDefinition>.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroupCollection"></xref> containing an element for each templated field in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView"></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the designer should use a temporary copy rather than the actual control associated with the designer to generate the design-time markup.

The UsePreviewControl property is always `true`, the designer uses a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> control that contains a copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control to generate the design-time markup.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> control does not affect any persistence for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView>.

If the UsePreviewControl property has been overridden to return `false`, the designer will use the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> itself to generate the design-time markup, and design-time changes to the control will persist to the page markup source.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the designer should use a temporary copy rather than the actual control associated with the designer to generate the design-time markup; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
